result.execSummary:
The defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $563.25 + $50 in drug testing fees= 613.25 plus attorney fees,  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/10/16 and on the 10th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. Oyawiri to provide a DNA sample.


****PER 8-19-16 ORDER for payment of Atty. Attorney Karl Huebner as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $231 .*****

Case called at 2:07pm [mo]
Defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri in court with attorney Karl E Huebner.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $563.25 + $50 in drug testing fees= 613.25 plus attorney fees,  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/10/16 and on the 10th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. Oyawiri to provide a DNA sample. 

recess: 2:18pm
Status conference on August 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2016 at 09:40 am.

Defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Bond remains as fixed.

recess: 2:05pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/27/16 at 9:40am    (2)  Status Conference on 8/5/16 at 2:00pm

Attorney Karl Huebner
The Petition is Granted. Repayment at the rate of $25 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 6/15/2016. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:43am. 
Defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Oyawiri reports that he does not qualify for PD representation, and that he intends to file out the petition form to request appointment of counsel. 
recess 9:44am, reconvene 10:04am.
Mr. Oyawiri submits his Petition for Appointment of Attorney, after it has been sworn to before the Court. 
The Court grants the Petition, requiring Mr. Oyawiri to make $25 per month payments toward attorney fees commencing on 6/15/16 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until further order of the Court.  
Mr. Oyawiri will be mailed information on the attorney who has been appointed for him. 
recess 10:07am.

NEXT:  (1) appointment of defense counsel (2) schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance/Status on 6/27/16 at 1:30pm-send notices

Reservie Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:55am.
Defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri in court.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Oyawiri indicates that he has made attempts to contact private counsel;  he spoke with two attorneys however their fees were higher than he can afford.
The Court reviews right to counsel.  The Court discusses with Mr. Oyawiri that he should go to the PD Office to have an eligibility determination done.
Mr. Oyawiri requests a four week adjournment; he feels that this will be sufficient time for him to obtain counsel.
The Court adjourns.
The Court continues the Bond.
recess 9:59am.

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/27/16 at 9:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on April 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 10:52am. 
Defendant Franklyn O Oyawiri in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; Mr. Oyawiri indicates that he is seeking private counsel, and he requests time to pursue this. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court requires $500  Signature bond, with conditions::
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a proper, valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a proper, valid prescription
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 10:57am 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 4/22/16 at 9:30am.
